title: language: add a for {} else {} construct
body:
by **brady@apcera.com**: 
This is a feature request for something that would likely have to some in a much later
release but I would like to propose the idea anyway. 

The idea is to add an else to the for loop construct. This is a condition that will be
triggered if the test condition for the loop returns false. Typically its impossible to
determine the difference between a test case failure, and a break. The destination jump
point for a test fase failure is typically set to the same as break, however allowing
these to be defined differently provides much more power with minimal complexity.

A simple use case to describe what I am asking for would be to detect the presence of a
number in a list, break when found, and if not found return an error. It seems that the
code for this is somewhat more complex that it would be with the feature I am proposing.
Here are two methods that currently work, and a commented out proposal:
http://play.golang.org/p/3xVFaNQcW8

Is this reasonable and worth doing?
